title: E field of distribution - 120 degree circular arc

content.question: A curved piece of insulating material is in the shape of a <math alttext="120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>120</mn></math>-degree circular arc and lies along a circle of radius <math alttext="0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The insulator has a uniform linear charge density of <math alttext="lambda equals, 2.0 microcoulombs per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μC/m</mtext></math>. The magnitude of the electric field at point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, the center of the circle, is most nearly

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
